column4: oh... well that's just dandy.  Close one app and KDE kicker crashes.  Now it won't even restart, just crashes every time
At the moment, I swear the perception that a graphical linux desktop environment is more reliable than a vanilla Windows XP install is so not true
i strongly differ
most people i got to switch over here from win to nix is because of the gnome layout
try gnome
woudln't I just be in danger of swapping one set of problems for another one?  Also, some would presumably persist, e.g. firefox, evolution
none of these are showstoppers, just grind you down.
shudnt hope so.. kde crashes a lot on me while gnome stays stable
Well, heck I'll give it a go.  I have Gnome installed anyway
It's wierd.  So much stuff in Linux is just amazing, but a lot of it feels like exactly what it is .. a work in progress
:) that i agree with
most of these bugs, when apport picks them up, when I get to launchpad I find that they've been reported dozens of times already, so I'm not the only one :)
nothing crashed yet ;)
yay gnome :P
really.. :S i am pretty confortable with gnome
what went wrong?

first, firefox stopped loading pages, but networking was still OK - konqueror still worked.  Then it just went downhill from there... eventually it forgot my keyboard layout, all the control panel apps would start then exit immediately, i was getting wierd drawing effects on widgets in most programs, gnome-terminal would segfault immediately (although konsole still worked), and even the logout dialog would only appear some of the time, and
lol... thats very weird
I logged back into KDE, and everything works OK, including the gnome-terminal and firefox :)
I'm still getting some wierd widget things on some gnome apps.  I've turned off the KDE setting that tries to make gnome apps use KDE styles
It seems to be helping - probably need to restart KDE to be sure
I'd really like it to work because I was digging it, but I can't deal with all that
gut feeling is that it's to do with styles and widgets, and KDE conflicting with GTK somehow
